Key Arguments: The ability to comment freely without recrimination is crucial.
Historical examples show that suppression of dissenting voices slows societal progress.
Censorship should be limited to incitement to violence.
Free debate is essential for societal function, as seen in parliamentary and legal systems.
Suppression of alternative views, especially in science and health, has historically hindered progress.
Personal experience suggests that suppression of alternative views on COVID-19 vaccines is harmful.
Main Themes: Importance of debate in democratic societies
Notable Quotes: The ability to make comment freely and without recrimination.
Suppression of voices, not in line with government policy, created a society frightened to speak up and halted/slowed its advance.
Suppression of alternative views to Government and Media Line is detrimental to safety and survival of All Australians.
